<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Undead Slayer Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3474) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 28</row>

**Archetype** [Undead Slayer](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=174)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)

</column>

---

Your training has prepared you to recognize most [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) on sight. You become trained in two [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skills, each about a specific type of undead, or become an expert if you were already trained. You gain the Slayer's Identification free action.

 **Slayer's Identification** <actions string="Free Action" /> **Trigger** You roll initiative and can observe a creature you know is undead; **Effect** You attempt to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) to identify the undead creature with a +1 circumstance bonus. If you're a master in the skill you're using to Recall Knowledge, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus instead.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the undead slayer archetype.

<title level="2">Undead Slayer Dedication leads to...</title>
[Blessed Medicine](/Feats.aspx?ID=3475), [Frighten Undead](/Feats.aspx?ID=3479), [Gear Up](/Feats.aspx?ID=3480), [Hunter's Sanctum](/Feats.aspx?ID=3476), [Necromantic Resistance](/Feats.aspx?ID=3477), [Slayer's Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=3478)
name: Undead Slayer Dedication
